umbral_vassal_income_tooltip: The income you receive from an <hyperlink>Umbral Dwelling</hyperlink> with whom you share an <rs_vassalage></rs_vassalage> <hyperlink>Eldritch Pact</hyperlink> depends on the resources the dwelling has available.

crystal_dwelling_income_tooltip: The <hyperlink>Crystal Dwelling</hyperlink> will grant passive <knowledge></knowledge> <hyperlink>Knowledge</hyperlink> income when at an <rs_eternal></rs_eternal> <hyperlink>Eternal Pact</hyperlink>.

crystalize_unit: This unit has been preserved within crystal by the enemy.

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Grant +<amount></amount> <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Allow a <hyperlink>Mire Crocodile Temple</hyperlink> to be built.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Crocodile Spirit Nodes

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Grant +<amount></amount> <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Allow a <hyperlink>Storm Crow Temple</hyperlink> to be built.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Crow Spirit Nodes

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Grant +<amount></amount> <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Allow a <hyperlink>Glacial Mammoth Temple</hyperlink> to be built.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Mammoth Spirit Nodes

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Grant +<amount></amount> <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Allow a <hyperlink>Ash Sabertooth Temple</hyperlink> to be built.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Sabertooth Spirit Nodes

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Grant +<amount></amount> <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Allow a <hyperlink>Dune Serpent Temple</hyperlink> to be built.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Serpent Spirit Nodes

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Grant +<amount></amount> <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Allow a <hyperlink>Tunneling Spider Temple</hyperlink> to be built.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Spider Spirit Nodes

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Grant +<amount></amount> <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Allow a <hyperlink>Sylvan Wolf Temple</hyperlink> to be built.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Wolf Spirit Nodes

abort_sector_operation_button_tooltip:
Abort execution of the province operation.



All spent resources will be refunded.
absorbing_description: Absorbing a <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> makes it part of your <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> under your direct control, retaining its original race and culture.
action_queue_fail_warning: Cannot queue actions at this moment
added_resistance: Added to Resistance <resistance></resistance> to calculate damage sustained from <STR_DamageChannelName></STR_DamageChannelName>.
add_new_production: Add a new production entry to the queue.
advisor_description:
The Advisor shows new tutorial and advice messages. Advice messages contain tips about the current situation of your empire.



It can be accessed through the ? banner located near the bottom right of the screen.
allow_spells_autocombat: Allow the AI to use spells in Auto Combat
already_structure_on_hex: There's already a structure on this hex
arcana_shared: Astral <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink> <empirearcana></empirearcana> seeks to unravel the cosmic powers and harness the pure magic that shapes reality. Associated with Scrying, Illusions, Enchantment, Summoning, and Meta-magic.
arcane_inspiration_tooltip: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Combat Spell</hyperlink> gain inspiration upon completing a combat in which the spell was used at least once.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>World Map Spell</hyperlink> gain inspiration for each use.</bullet></bulletlist>
army_description:
An army is a collection of maximum 6 Unit.



Armies can be moved on the World Map, explore Location, collect Treasure, and engage in Combat.
ascend_leader:
<> conquest of the realm has given <> a chance to ascend to your Pantheon. Will you grant <> ascendance?

(The leader will join your Pantheon and potentially assist during future conquests.)
ascend_leader_alreadyascended:
has conquered a realm while already having ascended to your Pantheon. Will you update <> entry in the Pantheon?

[fireCol](This will overwrite the current settings and recorded data for in the Pantheon.)[/fireCol]
ascend_leader_deletecustom: <STR_LeaderName></STR_LeaderName> is a custom Ruler. Upon accepting, <<p:STR_LeaderName>> will be moved into your Pantheon and be removed from the custom Rulers list. You can still play and encounter Rulers from the Pantheon.
ascend_leader_title_alreadyascended: <STR_LeaderName></STR_LeaderName> has already ascended to the Pantheon!
assign_governor: Assign a Governor to gain its Renown Level bonuses
astral_echoes_description: Mysterious whispers of the Astral Sea, only visible to and collectible by Mystics.
astral_echoes_tooltip:
Astral Echoes are special resources gained through:

Astral Echoes Treasure, only visible to and collectible by Ruler of certain Mystic Subcultures.



This resource is used for Echo Casting by the Mystic School of Attunement.



This resource is used for Echo Infusion by the Mystic School of Summoning.
attack_shop:
The shopkeeper won't allow you to trade any longer after attacking.

You need at least 1 nearby stack to attack the shop.
automove_units_can_move: After automatic movement, some of your armies have Move Points left.
autosave_start_ps4: Saving... Don't turn off your PlayStationÂ®5 console while saving is in progress!
autosave_start_xbox: Saving... Don't turn off your Xbox while saving is in progress!
boost_description:
Boosting a Structures reduces its cost by .



Boosts automatically apply when the requirements are met.
cancel_are_you_sure_realm: If you go back now, changes to this realm will not be saved. Are you sure?
cannot_place_in_water: Can't place this structure in water.
cannot_place_outside_water: Can't place this structure out of the water
cannot_speed_march: One or more units cannot Forced March this turn.
cannot_use_operation_on_center_sector: This spell can only be cast at a province center.
cant_queue_action_description:
Your last move, change or order could not be processed due to a player decision taking priority.

You may want to try again shortly.
cant_queue_action_title: Cannot queue order at this moment!
can_hurry_production: You have already used 'Hurry Production' this turn.
can_not_annex_sectors: This city cannot annex new provinces
captured_description: Captured units may be recruited after combat by spending <warspoils></warspoils> <hyperlink>War Spoils</hyperlink> or <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> for non-Reaver empires.
captured_description_no_warspoils: Captured units may be recruited after combat by spending <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink>.
captured_unit: This unit has been captured by the enemy.
catchmentpreview_tooltip: View which armies would aid this army in battle if it was attacked
chaos_empire_description: Chaos Affinity is opposed by Path of Faith.
chaos_shared: Chaos <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink> <empirechaos></empirechaos> is the cosmic power of change and destruction. Associated with conquest, strife, and demonic forces.
cheat_description: Enter = Run. Shift+Enter to keep the window open.
choose_tome: Choose your first Tome of Magic
choose_tome_next: Choose your next Tome of Magic
city_battlement_structure_description:
Battlement Structures are a type of City Defense Structure which spawns Battlement obstacles directly behind the walls in Combat during a siege.



Battlement obstacles provide buffs for units standing inside them.



When multiple Battlement Structures are built, only the most powerful Battlement obstacles will be present in Combat.
city_cap_description:
The number of City your Empire can control.



Exceeding your City Cap results in City Income to all your City for each City above City Cap.



Your City Cap can be increased through Empire Development
city_cap_description_short:
The number of City you can control without suffering economic penalties.

City Cap can be increased through the Empire Development tree.
city_cap_penalty: -<Value></Value>% City Income due to <NumOver></NumOver> <<m:City>> over the City Cap
city_cap_warning_description:
Each city you have over the City Cap reduces income of all of your City.



If you proceed, you will have exceeded the cap by City and your City will suffer an income penalty of City Income.



Your City Cap can be increased through Empire Development
city_cap_warning_title: Warning: You are about to go over the City Cap
city_description:
Cities are located on the World Map. Cities are built by upgrading an Outpost or conquered through War.



A city may either belong to an Empire or be a Edendam.



The Domain of a city expands according to its Population. Cities provide City Income, which can be improved by adding Structures and Research Posts.
city_found_cost: Cost of founding a new city:
city_income_description: City Income is the amount of <hyperlink>Resource</hyperlink> a <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> generates each <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink>.
city_morale_description: <bulletlist><bullet>High Stability boosts <food></food> <hyperlink>Growth</hyperlink>, <unitprod></unitprod> <hyperlink>Draft</hyperlink>, and <structureprod></structureprod> <hyperlink>Production</hyperlink> income.</bullet><bullet>Low Stability reduces all <hyperlink>City Income</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Very Low Stability can lead to the city losing <hyperlink>Province</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>
city_morale_description_rioting: <riotingvalue></riotingvalue> <hyperlink>City Income</hyperlink>. There is a chance that the provinces might defect from the city.
city_name_allready_exists: A city with this name already exists!
city_repair_province_reminder: A ruined province can be rebuilt!
city_ruins_description: Remnants of a <hyperlink>City</hyperlink>. Can be rebuilt into a city for a cost.
city_structure_description:
City Structures provide economic bonuses for the City they are built in.



They usually cost Production and Gold, and are built using the Structure Queue.
city_support_structure_description:
Support Structures are a type of City Defense Structure which adds Combat Enchantment to the Combat in a siege.



These Combat Enchantment add tactical benefits to the Defender in Combat.



Multiple Support Structures can be built and active in one City.
city_tower_structure_description:
Tower Structures are a type of City Defense Structure which spawns Tower units in Combat during a siege.

Tower units are typically long range units that cannot move and act automatically.



When multiple Tower Structures are built, only the most powerful Tower units will be present in Combat.
city_wall_structure_description:
Wall Structures are a type of City Defense Structure which adds the requirement to siege the City before hostile armies can attack.



They also define the Wall obstacles present in Combat during a siege.



When multiple Wall Structures are present, only the strongest Wall obstacle is present in combat.
concept_empire_development_description:
Contains Empire Skill that can improve your empire's economy and unlock important abilities such as Seafaring and Tunneling.



Empire Skill become available when enough Affinity Progress has been attained towards that particular Affinity. Available Empire Skill can be unlocked at any time by paying their Imperium cost.
concept_empire_skill_description:
Unlocks Empire-wide bonuses or grants powerful one-off rewards. Acquired via Empire Development.



Empire Skills require certain levels of Affinity to unlock.
concept_speed_march_description:
Forced March can be used to force your units to move further on the World Map than they would normally be able to in a single Turn.



When Forced March is activated units gain % of their Move Point but lose % of their current {LOC.CONCEPT@HITPOINTS@NAME}. They also become Exhausted for Turn. Forced March costs Mana per unit in the army.



The ability to use Forced March can be unlocked through Empire Development .
contact_info_description: Receive direct contact information for another <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> of the <Race.Name></Race.Name> race and establish a relationship. Their location in the realm will not be revealed, but diplomatic interactions and effects will be enabled.
contact_info_description_colonies: Receive direct contact information for another <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> of the <Race.Name></Race.Name> race and establish a relationship. Making contact will reveal <NumCities></NumCities> <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> belonging to the target Ruler and diplomatic interactions and effects will be enabled.
continue_anyway: Do you want to continue anyway?
create_world_description: A realm of your own creation
crypt_description:
When you defeat an enemy <> in combat, they have a chance to go to your Prison or your crypt.



The remains of these heroes can be sold to get their equipment and some gold.
culture_filtering_description: Select the cultures that can be chosen for <hyperlink>Player</hyperlink> and <minorcity></minorcity> <hyperlink>Edendam</hyperlink>. Independent spawners may still use disabled cultures.
dead_lord_tooltip: The Lord or Lady of this house is dead. A new one will be chosen in a few turns.
delete_are_you_sure_faction: Are you sure you want to delete this faction?
delete_are_you_sure_pantheon_hero:
Are you sure you want to expel this Ruler from the Pantheon?



You can still play with this ruler after expelling them; rulers are restored to the library or custom factions list, but lose any Ascension Trait and Race Transformation.
delete_are_you_sure_realm: Are you sure you want to delete this realm?
dismantle_tooltip: Dismantle the structure and remove it from the city.
dominated_unit: This unit has been magically dominated by the enemy.
dormant_description: Dormant skills do not grant any gameplay effects and cannot be reset.
echo_casting_tooltip:
Echo casting allows the use of Astral Echo to replace casting points, letting the user cast spells beyond the limit their casting points would otherwise allow.



Tactical spells that cost more Combat Casting Point than remain may substitute them with Astral Echo.

Strategic spells may be rushed while they are priming in the spellbook, costing Astral Echo to substitute the remaining World Map Casting Point.
echo_infusion_tooltip:
Echo Infusion allows the use of Astral Echo to empower Magic origin units granting them additional ranks.



The cost of this infusion is based on the remaining Experience required before the unit reaches the next rank.
empire_description:
An empire consists of a Ruler, their Army, City and Domain.



An empire that has lost both its Ruler and Throne City is defeated.
empire_dragon_type_warning: Ascended Dragons cannot change their starting affinity.
empire_progression_max_points_reached: Maximum number of Empire Progression Points reached!
excavation_description:
Excavation is a World Map ability available to Unit which allows them to dig through tunnels and clear out Province in the Underground that lies underneath Earthen terrain.



Excavation can open up new paths, uncover buried Treasure, or even discover hidden Location.
execute_hero_tooltip: Execute this hero, moving them to your crypt. This will impact your relations with <Owner></Owner> by <RelationModifier></RelationModifier><badrelation></badrelation>. This is an act of evil, <AlignmentModifier></AlignmentModifier><evilact></evilact>.
execute_hero_tooltip_generic: Execute this hero, moving them to your crypt. This is an act of evil, <AlignmentModifier></AlignmentModifier><evilact></evilact>.
exiled_unit: Unit is exiled to the Umbral Abyss
exit_confirmation: Are you sure you wish to leave this realm?
fog_of_war_description:
Hexes on the World Map that have been previously revealed but you currently have no vision of through Army or Location owned by you are covered by Fog of War.



Hexes within Fog of War appear darker than when revealed by vision, but will still reveal terrain types, roads and Location. Neutral and Hostile Army are not visible within Fog of War unless sensed by Sensing Range.



Through Treaty and Diplomatic State you may reveal other City. But they will still be covered by Fog of War.
form_filtering_description: Select the forms that can be chosen for <hyperlink>Player</hyperlink>, <minorcity></minorcity> <hyperlink>Edendam</hyperlink> and independent spawners.
founding_description: <hyperlink>Outpost</hyperlink> can be transformed into <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> by founding a <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> when selecting them for an <influence></influence> <hyperlink>Imperium</hyperlink> cost. This cost increases the more <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> your <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> contains.
generate_ruler_settings: Select what options will be used for generating new factions.
giant_description: Giants are more than the brutal monsters they are often portrayed as, for these world-builders of old know the lands like no other. The society of people following them has realized this and look to them for guidance, despite their monstrous heritage.
governor_description:
A Governor is a Ruler or <> assigned to govern a City.



Each hero has a Governance Trait that determines the bonuses they give to their city. These bonuses can be increased with Renown earned from fulfilling the hero's Ambition.



A Ruler is always the Governor of their Throne City.
governor_switch_warning: Unable to switch governor as this is the Throne City!
governor_tooltip_intro: While <hyperlink>Governor</hyperlink>, the governed <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> gains benefits based on the <renown></renown> <hyperlink>Renown</hyperlink> Level of this <hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink>.
happiness_description: Happiness is used as an income for the happiness event. Positive happiness leads to a happiness event. Negative happiness leads to unrest and riots.
hero_cannot_afford: Cannot afford the recruit cost for this <<<hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink>>>.
hero_cap_confirm:
Recruiting this hero will cause your empire to go over your Hero Cap. This hero will cost additional Gold to recruit and cost each turn until the cap is increased or a hero dies.



Are you sure you want to recruit this hero?
hero_cap_description:
The hero cap represents the number of <> your Empire can support.



You cannot recruit more heroes beyond the cap. The cap will increase automatically as the game goes on. You can spend Imperium to increase it instantly.
hero_cap_description_short: The number of <hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink> your <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> can support.
hero_cap_warning: Your <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> has reached its <unitHero></unitHero> <hyperlink>Hero Cap</hyperlink>. New <hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink> cannot be recruited until the cap increases.
house_trespassing: An army of <HouseBCapital.Name></HouseBCapital.Name> was found invading our domain.
house_trespassing_description: A hostile army belonging to <HouseBCapital.Name></HouseBCapital.Name> was found invading our domain and may set out to attack us. We should attack them instead, or negotiate an end to our war with them.
house_upgrade_set_integrateinfo: Once integrated, the special units of this city remain available through the <hyperlink>Rally of the Lieges</hyperlink> and the city keeps contributing +<Points></Points><recruitmentPoints></recruitmentPoints> <hyperlink>Recruitment Point</hyperlink>.
hurry_production: Instantly complete this item based on the leftover resources needed.
hurry_production_blocked: It is not possible to hurry production on this structure.
hyperlink_description: As you can see, this tooltip opened as you hovered over the hyperlink. Now try hovering over this <hyperlink>Hyperlink</hyperlink> to open a tooltip within the tooltip!
increase_herocap_cantafford: You cannot currently afford the costs of increasing the hero cap
increase_herocap_tooltip: Immediately increase the <unitHero></unitHero> <hyperlink>Hero Cap</hyperlink> by 1 for a cost of <BoostCost></BoostCost>.
insufficient_funds_description: You don't have the <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> or <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> to pay this unit's <hyperlink>Upkeep</hyperlink>. It will suffer a <MoralePenalty></MoralePenalty> <hyperlink>Morale</hyperlink> penalty, and there is a chance it will desert your armies.
invalid_celldata: Invalid hex selected; cannot build here
in_domain: Cannot build this structure in a player's domain
keeper_description:
The Race Keeper is the Ruler whose Empire has the biggest presence of a race, through owned City and vassalage. You are always the Keeper of the race you start with.



To become the Keeper of a Race you need to have % of the race's Population in your Empire. If the race already has a Race Keeper you need Population more than them to take it from them.



To become the Keeper of another player's starting race the player would have to be defeated first.



The Race Keeper is the only Ruler who can apply Major Race Transformation and Minor Race Transformation.
keeper_requirement: <INT_PopulationThreshold></INT_PopulationThreshold><population></population> <hyperlink>Population</hyperlink> is needed to become the <hyperlink>Keeper</hyperlink> of this race.
leader_problem: There is a problem with player <INT_playerID></INT_playerID>'s Ruler! Please contact the mapmaker to fix this!
leader_type_filtering_description: Select the ruler origins that can be chosen for <hyperlink>Player</hyperlink>.
login_with_paradox_account: Log in with your Paradox account
matter_shared: Materium <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink> <matter></matter> relates to physical magic. It is associated with resource extraction, transmutation and mastery over the mundane physical world.
met_player_while_concealed:
Diplomatic interactions have not been triggered and the other Ruler is unaware of our presence. We can choose to engage with and meet the Ruler or to remain concealed.



This message will be shown only once. Remaining concealed means you will need to meet the Ruler through other means or by standing adjacent to them.
migrating_description: Migrating a <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> makes it part of your <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> under your direct control, replacing its original race and culture with yours.
militaryaid_available: Cities that are loyal to you have put forward a list of draftable units.
militaryaid_boost_tooltip:
[tooltipHeader]Muster the Lieges[/tooltipHeader]

Costs:



This reduces the time until the next Rally starts by , which costs . The cost is determined by the number of you have and the duration until the next Rally. After the boost, the remaining duration will be .
militaryaid_boost_warning_alreadyboosted: [fireCol]Cannot Boost: Already boosted! You can boost again when the next Rally starts[/fireCol]
militaryaid_boost_warning_cantafford: [fireCol]Cannot Boost: Cannot afford the boost costs![/fireCol]
militaryaid_boost_warning_nopoints: [fireCol]Cannot Boost: You currently have no recruitment points in the next Rally.[/fireCol]
militaryaid_notarget: There is no target city for the units to spawn!
militaryaid_recruit_description: Select the city where the units should be recruited to. The army will arrive in 2<turn></turn>.
militaryaid_recruit_tooltip:
[tooltipHeader]Recruit Units[/tooltipHeader]

Costs: ,

Upkeep:



Hires the selected army which will spawn at the chosen city after .
militaryaid_recruit_tooltip_with_city:
[tooltipHeader]Recruit Units[/tooltipHeader]

Costs: ,

Upkeep:



Hires the selected army which will spawn at after .
militaryaid_reinforce_description: Select a vassal city to reinforce with troops under the city's control. The army will arrive in 2<turn></turn>.
militaryaid_reinforce_guard_tooltip:
[tooltipHeader]Guard [/tooltipHeader]

Costs: ,



Gift the selected army to . The army will spawn as static defenders at after .
militaryaid_reinforce_joinmission_descri: Select a vassal city from which troops will join the next mission.
militaryaid_reinforce_joinmission_toolti:
[tooltipHeader]Join next mission from [/tooltipHeader]

Costs:



Gift the selected army to . The units will spawn when sends out their next army to attack/defend and will be added to the army to aid in their mission.
militaryaid_reinforce_patrol_tooltip:
[tooltipHeader]Patrol 's Domain[/tooltipHeader]

Costs: ,



Gift the selected army to . The army will spawn at after and will patrol their domain.
militaryaid_reinforce_tooltip:
[tooltipHeader]Reinforce Vassal[/tooltipHeader]

Costs: ,



Gift the selected army to one of your vassals. The army will spawn as defenders at the vassal's capital after .
militaryaid_wait: Your loyal cities are still assembling a new roster of units.
mortal_champion_description: Mortal Champions are the chosen heroes of their people. It takes dedication and resolve to make a stand among the other powerful beings of this universe. To underestimate these Rulers would be a fatal mistake.
multi_stack_controller_instructions: To add this stack to the selected stacks
multi_stack_mkb_instructions: Shift + <leftmousebutton></leftmousebutton> to add this stack to the selected stacks
name: Name
name_too_few_chars: The name must contain at least 1 character.
name_too_many_chars: The name contains too many characters!
nature_shared: Nature <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink> <empirenature></empirenature> governs the energies of life, promoting growth and revitalization. It is associated with farming, druidism and control over the living world.
negotiate_tooltip: Negotiate trade deals, change the Diplomatic State, form treaties, send gifts or make demands.
not_all_trait_points_spent_description: You have not spent all of your trait points. Are you sure you want to continue?
not_enough_gold_hurry_production: You don't have enough gold to hurry production.
no_map_cells_collected: Data on <STRING.NumCells></STRING.NumCells> map cells has been collected
no_map_data_found: No new map data was found
order_shared: Order <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink> <order></order> is the power that brings structure to the Cosmos and to the lives of mortals. Associated with light, faith, justice, and the government of empires.
out_of_sync_try_reload: The game is out of sync with the other players. Press reload to try to automatically fix this.
overwrite_savegame_warning_content: Are you sure you want to overwrite save game <STR_FileName></STR_FileName>?
pantheon_ascendedskillunlock: The effects of this skill unlock when the hero reaches level: <UnlockLevel></UnlockLevel>
pantheon_ascendedtransformation_descript: Ascended transformations are <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Race Transformation</hyperlink> that a <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> had when they ascended to the <hyperlink>Pantheon</hyperlink>. The ascended transformations only apply to the Ruler (not their race) when they next appear on a realm.
pantheon_ascended_description:
An ascended Ruler has proven worthy to join the Pantheon and can be selected to appear as either a recruitable <> or as Ruler.



Ascended Rulers may receive an Ascension Trait and can keep Race Transformation for when they next appear on a realm.
pantheon_ascensiontrait_description: An ascension trait is received by a <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> upon conquering a realm. A Ruler can only have one ascension trait and can choose a trait based on the <hyperlink>Tome</hyperlink> they have unlocked on the realm.
pantheon_ascensiontrait_description_shor: A <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> can have one <hyperlink>Ascension Trait</hyperlink> which empowers them on their next conquest as either a Ruler or <hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink>.
pantheon_cheat_noxp: [errorcolor]No XP was rewarded because a cheat was used[/errorcolor]
pantheon_delete_tooltip: Expel this <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> from your <hyperlink>Pantheon</hyperlink>. They will be available in the library or be restored to the custom factions list and remain playable, but lose any <hyperlink>Ascension Trait</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Race Transformation</hyperlink>.
pantheon_enable_disable_tooltip: Depending on this setting, this Godir will show up as a recruitable <hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink> or an AI <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink>.
pantheon_intro_desc:
<hyperlink>Magehaven</hyperlink> is a sanctuary between worlds. From here, powerful Rulers called <hyperlink>Godir</hyperlink> venture to realms within the <hyperlink>Astral Sea</hyperlink>. 

As you conquer realms, other Godir will gather in Magehaven and join your Pantheon. 
You will also gather Pantheon Experience, which unlocks new options for creating your Godir and their followers. Your Pantheon will tell your story of the Fourth Age of Wonders.

Step through the <hyperlink>World Gate</hyperlink>. Your first adventure awaits!
pantheon_points_desc: Gather Pantheon points to unlock new customization options for your Godir in Magehaven.
pantheon_points_frontend: <PantheonPoints></PantheonPoints> Pantheon points available. <PantheonXP></PantheonXP>/<PantheonXPPerLevel></PantheonXPPerLevel> Pantheon XP for the next point.
pantheon_points_gained_by: Pantheon XP is gained through many actions such as Conquest, forming alliances, unlocking new <hyperlink>Tome</hyperlink>, advancing your <hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink> and exploring the world.
pantheon_points_limit: If you amass enough Pantheon Points to unlock everything, you will not gain additional Pantheon points as your Pantheon gains levels.
pantheon_points_session: <PantheonPoints></PantheonPoints> Pantheon points earned in this session so far. <PantheonXP></PantheonXP>/<PantheonXPPerLevel></PantheonXPPerLevel> Pantheon XP for the next point.
pantheon_requires_connected: Requires a connected item to be unlocked
personality_ai_tooltip:
The AI personality is an optional setting which determines the personality of a Ruler when you encounter them as an AI controlled Ruler in different sessions. This setting does not affect your empire when you are playing as this Ruler.



The personality affects the choices and behavior of AI Rulers in terms of Diplomacy, Research, Economy, and Military. When using the Default option, the system will pick a personality based on the starting Affinity and good heart of your custom Ruler when it is AI controlled.
personality_default_tooltip: The default personality makes sure that the system will choose a personality for this <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> automatically when it is AI controlled. Each personality has ties to one or several <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink> and may also have a preferred <hyperlink>good heart</hyperlink>, the combination of these, at the start of a session, determines which personality will be chosen automatically for your ruler if you encounter them as an AI ruler.
personality_hidden_desc: The personality of this ruler is unknown, though it can be discovered through interaction or by triggering their personal preferences.
personality_like_description: Informs how they respond to the actions of other empires
personality_strategy_description: Informs their behavior on the Strategic Map
pillaging_description:
Some locations such as Research Posts cannot be Razed but can be pillaged instead, granting Resource rewards.



When a province improvement is pillaged it is turned into ruins. Ruins can be rebuilt at the cost of Gold.
player_description: A player is a human or AI commanding an <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> and its <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink>.
player_name_set_description: Your Paradox account does not have an associated social name set up. Please provide your preferred player name to play in multiplayer mode.
player_name_set_fail_already_taken: This name is already taken. Please try another one.
player_trespassing: <HouseBLord.Name></HouseBLord.Name> was found trespassing in your domain
player_trespassing_description: You will receive <CasusBelliPoints></CasusBelliPoints><casusbelli></casusbelli> for each turn that a Ruler you are not at war with is trespassing in your domain. This can be used to denounce or declare war on that Ruler.
population_buy_tooltip: Instantly increases your <population></population> <hyperlink>Population</hyperlink>. The cost is determined by the number of <turn></turn> turns required to increase the <population></population> population.
population_description:
Population represents the size of a City. It allows the City to build new Research Posts and expand its Domain.



Population increases with Growth income and requires Population Upkeep.
population_upkeep_description:
Each Population in a City costs Growth and stability.



Negative Food income can lead to Starvation!
preparing_attack_tooltip: The next <hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> from <House.Name></House.Name> will be ready in <Duration></Duration><turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink>. If the target is set to None, then the army won't spawn until after a target is selected.
preparing_defense_tooltip: The next defensive <hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> from <House.Name></House.Name> will be ready in <Duration></Duration> <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink>. When there are no ongoing wars, the <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> can only send out armies to defend specified cities.
prison_description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Free City Lord</hyperlink> cannot go to Prison, and will go to the Crypt instead.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Marauder</hyperlink> Heroes cannot go to Prison, and will go to the Crypt instead.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> can never be captured, and will go to the <hyperlink>Void</hyperlink> instead.</bullet></bulletlist>
production_queue_description:
Production Queues in City allow for the construction of Structures and recruitment of Unit.



Production and Draft resources are used up when building the first item in the Production Queue. Items in the queue can be reprioritized after being added.
razing_description:
Army can remove an empire's Domain from a province by razing the Outpost or City at its center. Research Posts cannot be razed, but can be Pillaged instead.



Razing cities leaves behind ruins which can be rebuilt at the cost of Imperium.
reinforcement_rule_description:
The Reinforcement Rule allows up to 3 friendly Army that are within 3 hexes of a Combat engagement on the World Map to join one of the combatants.



There are exceptions to this rule. Combat while exploring an Ancient Wonder only allows 1 Army to participate on each side. Furthermore, Army in Location such as Infestation Spawner or City under siege will not join <Combat >> outside of their Location.
release_hero_tooltip: Release this hero from your prison. They will return to their home, improving your relations with <Owner></Owner> by <RelationModifier></RelationModifier><goodrelation></goodrelation>. This is an act of good, <AlignmentModifier></AlignmentModifier><goodact></goodact>.
release_hero_tooltip_generic: Release this hero from your prison. This is an act of good, <AlignmentModifier></AlignmentModifier><goodact></goodact>.
request_military_aid_description:
This is where you can draft Unit into your empire or to help defend Vassal Cities using Recruitment Point.



The pool of available units consists primarily of units made available to you by loyal City and annexed Ancient Wonder. The number of units available depends on how many Recruitment Points you have available. The units made available by cities will be randomly selected based on the units that city can produce, focusing on higher tier units.



Rallies will be held every 15 Turn and only at that point will the pool of units and the number of points you can spend refresh. You can, however, use a boost to halve the amount of remaining turns once per Rally.
requires_city_tier: Recruitable in cities with Town Hall <<R:<RequiredCityTier></RequiredCityTier>>>
respec_confirm_message: You are about to reset all of this hero's learned skills. Are you sure?
ritual_of_alacrity_description: Units standing on the center of this city or outpost restore <hppercentage></hppercentage> <hyperlink>{LOC.CONCEPT@HITPOINTS@NAME}</hyperlink>, <mppercentage></mppercentage> <hyperlink>Move Point</hyperlink>, and remove <hyperlink>Exhausted</hyperlink> from <hyperlink>Forced March</hyperlink>. The city or outpost has a <turn></turn> <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink> cooldown before it can use this again.
ritual_of_alacrity_tooltip:
Players can activate the Ritual of Alacrity on any owned Barbarian Outpost and City.



When activated, friendly Unit on the center of the Outpost or City will restore % {LOC.CONCEPT@HITPOINTS@NAME}, % Move Point, and removes Exhausted from Forced March.
routed_unit: This unit has been routed, but will reappear in a nearby city shortly.
ruler_void_description: <bulletlist><bullet>-20 <hyperlink>stability</hyperlink> in each city.</bullet><bullet>Governor bonuses are not applied.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Research</hyperlink> is paused.</bullet><bullet>No <hyperlink>Minor Transformations</hyperlink> can be cast.</bullet><bullet>Active <magicvictory></magicvictory> <hyperlink>magic</hyperlink> spells are canceled and their progress reset.</bullet></bulletlist>
save_prompt_text:
You have made some unsaved progress. Do you want to save your game before exiting?



Your save data will be saved as "".
sector_selector: Choose a province <STR_Buttontag></STR_Buttontag> in which to build a <STR_StructureUpgradeName></STR_StructureUpgradeName> for <STR_CityName></STR_CityName>. This will replace the current upgrade in that province.
select_spell: Select a spell to cast or prepare
sell_equipment_rewards_desc: Disenchanting destroys the equipment rewards in exchange for <bindingessence></bindingessence> Binding Essence and <bindingfragments></bindingfragments> Fragments. Are you sure you want to do this?
sensor_range_description: Sensing Range is the number of hexes within which the presence of <hyperlink>Unit</hyperlink> can be detected in the <hyperlink>Fog of War</hyperlink>.
shadow_shared: Shadow <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink> <empireshadow></empireshadow> relates to the realm of death, decay and ice, as well as deception and instilling and exploiting weakness.
shared_opposing_affinity: <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink> or <minorcity></minorcity> <hyperlink>Edendam</hyperlink> with opposing affinities will suffer relation penalties.
single_army_warning: Can only be entered by 1 <hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> led by a <hyperlink><<EventRuler{Hero/Heroine}>></hyperlink>!
special_province_improvement_description: <bulletlist><bullet>Improved income based on adjacent <hyperlink>Province</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> effects in and around the Special Province Improvement.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> spawn points.</bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> visit bonuses.</bullet></bulletlist>
speed_march: Activate <hyperlink>Forced March</hyperlink>: Units gain <movepoints></movepoints> of their <hyperlink>Move Point</hyperlink> but lose <hitpoints></hitpoints>% of their current <hyperlink>{LOC.CONCEPT@HITPOINTS@NAME}</hyperlink>. They also become <hyperlink>Exhausted</hyperlink> for <turns></turns> <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink>. Forced March costs <cost></cost> <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> in total.
spell_description: Spell Upkeep is paid each <turn></turn> <hyperlink>Turn</hyperlink> on the <hyperlink>World Map</hyperlink>. Each spell has its own <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> upkeep.
spell_overcharge_tooltip: <bulletlist><bullet><casttactical></casttactical> <hyperlink>Damage Spell</hyperlink> gain +<DamageBonus></DamageBonus>% damage.</bullet><bullet><casttactical></casttactical> <hyperlink>Healing Spell</hyperlink> gain +<HealingBonus></HealingBonus>% healing.</bullet><bullet><casttactical></casttactical> <hyperlink>Buff Spell</hyperlink> gain +<BolsteredBonus></BolsteredBonus> <hyperlink>Bolstered resistance</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet><casttactical></casttactical> <hyperlink>Debuff Spell</hyperlink> gain +<SunderedBonus></SunderedBonus> <hyperlink>Sundered resistance</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet><casttactical></casttactical> <hyperlink>Combat Enchantment</hyperlink> allow another spell to be cast that turn.</bullet><bullet><casttactical></casttactical> <hyperlink>Combat Summon Spell</hyperlink> gain +<StrengthenedBonus></StrengthenedBonus> <hyperlink>Strengthened</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>
stack_in_the_way: Another player's army is in the way
starting_conditions_easy_description: Start with <amount></amount> starting resources and a larger initial army.
starting_conditions_hard_description: Start with <amount></amount> starting resources and a smaller initial army.
starting_conditions_normal_description: Start with normal starting resources and a standard initial army.
starvation_description:
When Population Upkeep is higher than Growth income, the city's Population will starve.



Starvation leads to Population dying and a Research Posts leaving the city every << Turn>>
strategic_map_description: The World Map is where <hyperlink>City</hyperlink> are built, <hyperlink>Army</hyperlink> are moved, and <hyperlink>Location</hyperlink> are explored.
structure_queue_description: The Structure Queue is where <hyperlink>Structures</hyperlink> are built by spending <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> and <structureprod></structureprod> <hyperlink>Production</hyperlink>.
subtracted_weakness: Subtracted from Resistance <resistance></resistance> to calculate damage sustained from <STR_DamageChannelName></STR_DamageChannelName>.
surplus_description:
Knowledge, Production or Draft that is left over once research, construction or recruitment is completed.



This surplus will automatically be spent on the next item that you choose to research, build or recruit.



Surplus can only be kept for a single Turn
sustained_spells: Your sustained spells with a per turn upkeep
switch_turn_mode_classic: You are currently in Simultaneous Turns mode. Do you want to switch to Classic Turns? (All players will regain their turn in this round.)
switch_turn_mode_simultanious: You are currently in Classic Turns mode. Do you want to switch to Simultaneous Turns?
switch_turn_mode_simultanious_next_round: The turn mode will be changed to Simultaneous Turns in the next round. Do you want to cancel and go back to Classic Turns?
tactical_combat_description:
Combat occurs when an Army encounters an enemy Army, or while exploring Ancient Wonder.



Combat occurs on a separate map and is Turn-based.



With the reinforce, up to 6 armies can participate in the battle.



The battle is won by the last combatant that has Unit left.
throne_city_description: Your Throne City is the capital of your <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink>. Losing it and your <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> simultaneously ends your <hyperlink>Empire</hyperlink>.
throne_city_tooltip_missing: The <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> does not have a <throne></throne> <hyperlink>Throne City</hyperlink>. They will be defeated if their leader dies while not having a throne city to return to.
throne_city_tooltip_notdiscovered: You have not yet discovered the location of the <throne></throne> <hyperlink>Throne City</hyperlink> belonging to this <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink>.
tome_description: <bulletlist><bullet>Research 2 Tomes of any tier.</bullet><bullet>Tier 3 tomes require you to have <req3></req3> points of a single <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Tier 4 tomes require you to have <req></req> points of a single <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Tier 5 Tomes require you to have <req2></req2> points of a single <hyperlink>Affinity</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>
tooltip_description: Well done! Use this useful feature to learn about concepts and systems as you go. You can string together tooltips endlessly, however older ones will close as you go <hyperlink>deeper</hyperlink>.
too_far_to_annex: The province is too far away to annex.
too_few_chars: The text must contain at least 1 character.
too_many_chars: The text contains too many characters!
trade_away_casus_belli: The Ruler trading away the <hyperlink>Justification</hyperlink> receives an Alignment modifier:
trade_colony: This is a city. Trading it will transfer the following provinces:
trade_sector: Trading this province will instantly transfer ownership to the receiving Ruler. Trading will only succeed if the province is not occupied or being razed. Any units residing on the province center that belong to the previous owner will be moved away.
turn_description:
The unit of time in which Player carry out all of their actions.



On the World Map, turns take the form of either Classic Turn or Simultaneous Turn.



Turns during Combat are taken one Player after another.
turn_mode_changed_classic: <STR_Username></STR_Username> changed the turn mode to: Classic Turns
turn_mode_changed_simultaneous: <STR_Username></STR_Username> changed the turn mode to: Simultaneous Turns
turn_mode_changing: (Change will be applied on next round.)
underground_description: The layer of the <hyperlink>World Map</hyperlink> that can be accessed with Underground Passages.
units_can_act: You still have units that can act. If you end turn now, they will enter <hyperlink>Defense Mode</hyperlink>.
unit_description:
Units are the forces that make up your Army.



Units can explore the World Map and engage in Combat.



Can be recruited in City or summoned using Minor Transformations.



Units require Gold or Mana upkeep each Turn.
unit_upgrade_upkeep_description: Each <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Unit Enchantment</hyperlink> has its own upkeep cost in <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> and <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> which is added to the <hyperlink>Upkeep</hyperlink> of each <hyperlink>Unit</hyperlink> that is using it.
vassal_income_tooltip: The income you receive from your vassal depends on their resources and the state of your relations with them. Improving your relations with the <minorcity></minorcity> <hyperlink>Edendam</hyperlink> will increase how much they are willing to share with you.
viability_description:
Viability describes how likely it is for a Ruler to complete the Bounty objective.

Other Rulers may not be at war with you if they want to accept the bounty. They must also have met the target Ruler or Edendam, and AI controlled Rulers must be at war with the target.



For AI controlled Rulers, their army power and proximity to the target are also taken into account, as well as how strongly the target is defended. The viability also influences the chances of AI controlled Rulers accepting the bounty.
vision_range_description: Vision Range is the number of hexes that remove <hyperlink>Fog of War</hyperlink>.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target: Select the targeting mode for when the <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> sends out an army to attack.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target_auto: The <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> will automatically select the closest <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink> and send out armies to attack them.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target_defe: The <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> will send armies to the location and defend it against hostile armies.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target_hous: The <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> will send armies to attack a selected <minorcity></minorcity> <hyperlink>Edendam</hyperlink>.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target_infe: The <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> will send armies to attack a selected <hyperlink>Infestation</hyperlink>.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target_inva: The <minorcity></minorcity> <hyperlink>Edendam</hyperlink> cannot reach the target and will be unable to assist.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target_none: The <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> will not send out any armies to attack other <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink>.
war_coordination_pve_tooltip_target_play: The <hyperlink>Freecitytype</hyperlink> will send armies to attack a selected <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink>.
world_map_spells_description: <bulletlist><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>City Spell</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Enemy Army Spell</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Friendly Army Spell</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Major Race Transformation</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Minor Race Transformation</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Spell Victory</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Summon Spell</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Sustained City Spell</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Sustained World Spell</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Terraforming Spell</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>Unit Enchantment</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Spell</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
you_are_about_to_use_a_spec_op: You are about to cast a spell!
you_are_about_to_use_a_spec_op_trespasse: You are about to cast a spell on a Trespasser!
you_are_not_racekeeper: You are not the Race Keeper

fallback_tooltip: If there are not enough Ruler found that match the filters and all other enabled options are depleted, generated rulers will be used to fill the empty slots.

already_bought: This <hyperlink>Artifact</hyperlink> was already bought by a player!
description: <bulletlist><bullet>Artifacts are often part of a collection. Completing the collection will trigger an impactful Collection Happening.</bullet><bullet>Artifacts may be traded between <hyperlink>Player</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>When defeating a player, all Artifacts of that player are claimed by the defeating player.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Artifact

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Buffs allies and debuffs enemies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Heals and buffs allies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Buffs allies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

Casting Limit controls how many <hyperlink>World Map Spell</hyperlink> the user can cast in a single turn on the <hyperlink>World Map</hyperlink>. Casting Limit can be increased by building the <hyperlink>Channelingchamber</hyperlink> in your <hyperlink>Throne City</hyperlink>.
Damage reduced by <percentage></percentage>%
name: Casualties Taken

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Can affect the targeted city and its domain.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

A type of Minor Transformations that affects the entire battlefield.



While active, the spell triggers an effect at the start of the caster's Turn.

A type of Minor Transformations that summons a Unit with Magic origin onto any hex during Combat.



Units summoned in this way die when combat ends.

When a race adapts to its surroundings and the actions of their race keeper, the race council may decide to proclaim a new era for their people. When they do, they approach the race keeper in an event, where it is decided if this change will manifest into a destiny trait.



Destiny traits change a race's Affinity or good heart and need to be accepted with care, since they come with an inherent up- and downside.
name: Racial Destiny Traits

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Doesn't count towards arsenal effects.</bullet><bullet>Can not be disenchanted.</bullet><bullet>Can not be equipped.</bullet><bullet>Can not be traded with other rulers.</bullet></bulletlist>
title: Item Transportation

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Damages and debuffs enemies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Damages enemies and heals allies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Damages enemies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Debuffs enemies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>
Empire bonuses provide passive effects, new options or new mechanics. Once researched, they are immediately active and do not require a spell to be cast.
name: Empire Bonus

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Affects an enemy army.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Primary</bullet><bullet>Secondary</bullet><bullet>Head</bullet><bullet>Torso</bullet><bullet>Legs</bullet><bullet>Mount</bullet><bullet>Ring</bullet><bullet>Miscellaneous</bullet></bulletlist>
name: <item></item> Equipment

blocked_draft: Recent Events: All <unitprod></unitprod> <hyperlink>Draft</hyperlink> income is shared
blocked_food: Recent Events: All <food></food> <hyperlink>Growth</hyperlink> income is shared
blocked_production: Recent Events: All <structureprod></structureprod> <hyperlink>Production</hyperlink> income is shared

description: <bulletlist><bullet>The Governor becomes the <hyperlink>Liege lord</hyperlink> of that city's House.</bullet><bullet>Units produced in that City gain that City's House, gaining reduced upkeep and increased health regeneration while in their <hyperlink>Liege lord</hyperlink>'s army.</bullet><bullet>Units belonging to the house additionally gain a powerful boost in combat while their <hyperlink>Liege lord</hyperlink> is on the field.</bullet><bullet>These benefits increase based on the <hyperlink>Liege lord</hyperlink>'s <renown></renown> <hyperlink>Renown</hyperlink> Level.</bullet><bullet>In addition, when the <hyperlink>Liege lord</hyperlink> gains <renown></renown> <hyperlink>Renown</hyperlink> the units belonging to their house gain a small amount of <hyperlink>Experience</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Feudal Houses

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Feudal lord war</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Feudal lord crops</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Feudal lord knowledge</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Feudal lord magic</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Feudal lord production</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Feudal Lord

description:
- Immunity against Fire.

- Starts with Lava Walking.

- Spreads fire where they walk in combat.
name: Fire Giant

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Affects a friendly army.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

tooltip: Empty slots are allowed to procedurally generate new <hyperlink>Ruler</hyperlink>. <LOC.INTERFACE@TEXT@ALLOWED_LORDS@FALLBACK_TOOLTIP></LOC.INTERFACE@TEXT@ALLOWED_LORDS@FALLBACK_TOOLTIP>

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Heals allies in battle.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <optactical></optactical> <hyperlink>Combat Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

blocked_other_hero: Only one hero may learn this skill.

description:
- Starts with Mountaineering.

- +20 Hit Points.
name: Hill Giant

description:
Infusions are individual improvements that can be put on created items in the Item Forge. These can be Passive Properties, Active Abilities or Damage Channels.



An Infusion has an Infusion Point cost, which increases the cost to forge that item.



Each Infusion after the first also increases the total price of forging the item by %.
name: Infusion

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Item Tier I: 1 or 2 Infusion Points</bullet><bullet>Item Tier II: 3 Infusion Points</bullet><bullet>Item Tier III: 4 Infusion Points</bullet><bullet>Item Tier IV: 5+ Infusion Points</bullet></bulletlist>
name: Infusion Point

description:
The Item Forge is used to create new custom hero items. Forging items costs Binding Fragments, Gold, and time. Only a single item can be forged at a time.



The cost and time to forge an item depend on the amount of Infusion Point used to forge the item. The amount of Infusion also increases the cost.



The Infusions available are dependent on the types of Magic Material that you have collected. Collecting more of the same Magic Material will unlock more powerful Infusions.



The Item Forge can be build in your Wizard Tower.
description_short: The Item Forge is used to create new custom hero items.
name: Item Forge

description:
An item's tier is an indication of its power. The damage of Primary Weapons increases with each tier based on what type of weapon it is.



In the Item Forge, the item tier is determined by the amount of Infusion.
name: Item Tier

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Ritualist</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Elementalist</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Eldritch Relic Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Defender</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Warrior</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Death Knight</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Spellblade</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Fist Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Ritualist</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Elementalist</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Magic Orb Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Ritualist</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Elementalist</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Magic Ranged

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Ritualist</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Elementalist</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Magic Staff Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Defender</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Warrior</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: One Handed Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Defender</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Warrior</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Death Knight</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Spellblade</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Polearm Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Ranger</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Ranged Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Defender</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Warrior</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Death Knight</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Spellblade</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Shield

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Ranger</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Skirmisher Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Warrior</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Death Knight</hyperlink></bullet><bullet><hyperlink>Hero Class: Spellblade</hyperlink></bullet></bulletlist>
name: Great Weapon

description: <bulletlist><bullet>The caster must be the race's <hyperlink>Keeper</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>A race can have only one Major Race Transformation at a time.</bullet></bulletlist>
<bulletlist><bullet>The caster must be the race's <hyperlink>Keeper</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>A race can have a number of Minor Race Transformations at once.</bullet></bulletlist>

already_instant_primed: Can't hurry the same spell twice in one turn.
tooltip:
Hurry Casting:



Hurry casting this spell using Astral Echoes^p through Echo Casting.

description:
The natural feature of a Province, such as a forest, river, or grassy plain.



Determines which Research Posts can be built in a Province.



Note that you can only build Improvements allowed by province features that share the same geography type as the center of the province (Land, Lava, Water, and Void). For example, Coast only grants the ability to build a Fishing Farm if the center of the province consists of a water feature.

<bulletlist><bullet>The caster must be the race's <hyperlink>Keeper</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>A race can have any number of Minor Race Transformations at once.</bullet><bullet>A race can have only one Major Race Transformation at a time.</bullet></bulletlist>

unlock_requirement: <hyperlink>Rally of the Lieges</hyperlink> is unlocked after vassalizing a <minorcity></minorcity> <hyperlink>Edendam</hyperlink> or annexing an <hyperlink>Ancient Wonder</hyperlink>.

description:
When Industrious Scout unit stand within a friendly or neutral Province that contains a Cliff, Mountain or Stalagmite, the player that owns the Scout unit can prospect the Province for Production or Gold rewards.



Each Province can only be prospected once.
name: Scout Prospecting

description: This unit can prospect Cliff, Mountain or Stalagmite <hyperlink>Province</hyperlink>. This rewards <structureprod></structureprod> <hyperlink>Production</hyperlink>, <gold></gold> <hyperlink>Gold</hyperlink> or a Hero Item.

If a City has a Walls and you wish to conquer it, you first need to besiege it and breach its defenses.



A Siege can be initiated by attacking any of the 7 City hexes with at least 1 Army led by a <> which must remain adjacent to the city until the siege is completed or else the Siege is lifted.



While sieging the City's Fortification Health is lowered by the besieger's Fortification Damage.



Siege Project can be used to speed up the siege by dealing more Fortification Damage. They can also remove defenses and give the besieger an advantage.



Once Fortification Health reaches 0, the attacker can move into the City for a decisive battle.
name: Siege

description:
Siege Projects can be used during a siege to speed up the siege by adding more Fortification Damage. They can also remove defenses and give the besieger an advantage.



Siege Projects can only be added and removed in the Turn the siege was initiated.



You can only have as many siege projects added as you can have slots. More slots can be gained through Empire Skill.
name: Siege Project

description:
Spell slots are used to prepare spells ready for casting. Once your spell slots are full you will need to cast or cancel a prepared spell before you can start preparing any new spells. 

You can gain another spell slot by building the <hyperlink>Channelingchamber</hyperlink> in your <hyperlink>Throne City</hyperlink>.
<bulletlist><bullet>Initiates the path towards a magic victory by building three <hyperlink>Affinity Province Improvement</hyperlink> and performing a great ritual.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Summons a <hyperlink>Unit</hyperlink> with <hyperlink>Magic origin</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Can be cast on any hex adjacent to your heroes, ruler, or one of your cities.</bullet><bullet>Units with <hyperlink>Land movement</hyperlink> cannot be summoned onto water hexes.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>Can affect the targeted city and its domain.</bullet><bullet>The effect lasts as long as you pay mana each turn.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet>The effect lasts as long as you pay mana each turn.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>

<bulletlist><bullet><hyperlink>Terraforms</hyperlink> one or more <hyperlink>Province</hyperlink>.</bullet><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>
A passive bonus that is immediately active once the tome has been chosen.
An uninhabited province is a province that isn't part of anyone's <hyperlink>Domain</hyperlink> and doesn't contain an <hyperlink>Ancient Wonder</hyperlink>.
title: Uninhabited Province

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Affect both existing and newly created units.</bullet><bullet>Increase the <hyperlink>Upkeep</hyperlink> of affected units.</bullet><bullet>Can be canceled at any time by the caster.</bullet></bulletlist>

setting: Your vassal, [white]Free City Name[/white], is under siege!

description: <bulletlist><bullet>Costs <mana></mana> <hyperlink>Mana</hyperlink> and <caststrategic></caststrategic> <hyperlink>World Map Casting Point</hyperlink>.</bullet></bulletlist>
